title: Be Different: Adventures of a Free-Range Aspergian
description:
John Elder Robison, "Be Different: Adventures of a Free-Range Aspergian with Practical Advice for Aspergians, Misfits, Families & Teachers"
2011 | ISBN-10: 0307884813 | 304 pages | EPUB

In his bestselling memoir, Look Me in the Eye, John Elder Robison described growing up with AspergerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s syndrome at a time when the diagnosis didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t exist. He was intelligent but socially isolated; his talents won him jobs with toy makers and rock bands but did little to endear him to authority figures and classmates, who were put off by his inclination to blurt out non sequiturs and avoid eye contact.

By the time he was diagnosed at age forty, John had already developed a myriad of coping strategies that helped him achieve a seemingly normal, even highly successful, life. In Be Different, Robison shares a new batch of endearing stories
about his childhood, adolescence, and young adult years, giving the reader a rare window into the Aspergian mind.
